articles.title: Secy. Kim Jong Il enjoys light comedy
Fine art works produced by servicemen
articles.content:
Secy. Kim Jong Il enjoys light comedy
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed
the light comedy "Up to the Last" performed by film stars at 
the mansudae art theatre on Sunday to mark the 50th 
anniversary of the Korean Film Studio.
   The audience included Jo Myong Rok, Director of the KPA 
General Political Department= Kim Yong Chun, Chief of the 
KPA General Staff= secretaries of the Workers' Party of 
Korea Central Committee Choe Thae Bok, Kim Kuh Thae, Kim Ki 
Nam and Kim Yong Sun and other senior officials of the Party 
and the army as well as officers and men of the KPA.
   The light comedy is a story about efforts of a farm to 
implement the Party's policy of creating grass fields and 
growing grass-eating domestic animals in large numbers.
   Secretary Kim Jong Il congratulated the film stars on their
successful performance and sent thanks to the creating staff 
and artistes of the film studio.
   He noted with high appreciation that over the past 50 
years, the creating staff and artistes of the studio have 
produced many films of high ideological and artistic value 
and greatly contributed to educating the Party members and 
other working people on revolutionary lines and encouraging 
them to the revolution and construction.
   The studio has turned into a reliable film production 
centre of the nation that is greatly conducive to the 
Party's ideological work for the modelling of the whole 
society on the Juche idea and to the cultural education of 
people, he said, adding that the Party and the people are 
very proud of having this group of talented, experienced and 
loyal artistes, many of them being holders of honorary 
titles including "Kim Il Sung Prize," Labor Hero, People's 
Artiste and Merited Artiste.
   He gave the studio important tasks.

articles.title: S. Korean students, soldiers persecuted
articles.content:
Fine art works produced by servicemen
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) --  The Revolutionary Musuem 
of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces was replenished 
recently with some 60 pieces of successful fine art works 
produced by soldiers of the Korean People's Army.
   Soldiers presented these Korean paintings, oil paintings, 
jewel pictures, sculptures, embroideries and crafts to  
Secretary Kim Jong Il on his 55th birthday.
   The works reflect the resolution of the soldiers to 
exalt the undying feats of the great leaders President 
Kim Il Sung and Secretary Kim Jong Il in leading the army 
building and defend the Juche revolutionary cause with arms. 
   The Korean painting "Covering 10,000 km in leading 
century" depicts the on-site guidance of Secretary Kim Jong Il
to KPA units from the beginning to the last of last year.
   "The Spirit of Korea" (2.9 metres in height and 280 kg in 
weight), a wooden craft made of a 500-year-old dwarf 
elm, pictures a tiger of the Korean map type that stands 
above the pedestal of the earth form and another wooden 
craft "We will devotedly defend the headquarters of 
revolution with gunfire of Juche", made of roots of an 800-
year-old ash tree, shows the development of the artillery.
   A Korean jewel picture "Devoted Defence" 
depicts Secretary Kim Jong Il's image with jewels in the 
centre of a five-pointed star rising up above lake Chon on 
Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of the Korean revolution, 
which shows the soldiers' steadfast outlook on their leader.
   A glass-gem picture "kimjongilia vase" was 
made with 1,942 patterns and with 216,000 pieces of colorful 
glass 2 mm in diametre, which symbolize the birth date of 
Secretary Kim Jong Il (Feb. 16, 1942). Its color will remain 
unchanged for the purity of raw materials.
   Also included in the works are a craft "wish for 
longevity" depicting a flower basket of 216 blossoms 
including 55 kimjongilia blossoms with three-ton jade, and 
other works representing the best wishes for Secretary 
Kim Jong Il's good health and long life.
   Seeing the fine art works displayed in the Museum on 
March 4, Secretary Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction 
with the many works of high ideological and artistic value 
and highly appreciated them. 
   He said that the KPA soldiers are so prepared in politico-
ideological aspects and military technology that they each 
can match a hundred foes and that they also have high 
cultural and artistic attainments.

articles.title: Review of Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korean students, soldiers persecuted
  Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Kim Young Sam group of 
South Korea recently arrested ten students and put three 
soldiers into investigation, invoking the "National Security 
Law", for their activities for independence, democracy and 
national reunification.
   They allegedly formed a "national student solidarity" at 
a Seoul-based university in September 1992 and conducted 
anti-"government" activities through rallies and 
demonstrations, calling for political forces of the working 
class. Rodong Sinmun today views the persecution as another 
fascist outrage against pro-reunification, pro-democracy 
forces and urges the Kim Young Sam group to stop harsh 
suppression of students and people at once.
   In a commentary the daily says:
   the escalation of the fascist suppression of the pro-
reunification, pro-democracy forces by the Kim Young Sam 
group is aimed at emerging from the ruling crisis with an 
intensified fascist offensive against the pro-democracy 
forces. With their true colors as the chief culprit of the 
Hanbo incident unveiled, their regime has found itself in 
the most serious crisis since its appearance.
   No matter how Kim Young Sam may intensify the 
fascist suppression, can he never quell public anger against 
him and save his miserable fate.

articles.title: Kim Won Gyun concert
articles.content:
Review of Rodong Sinmun
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today 
highlights a report that Secretary Kim Jong Il on Sunday 
enjoyed the light comedy "Up to the Last" with officers and 
men of the Korean People's Army on the occasion of the 50th 
anniversary of the Korean Film Studio.
   Appearing in the paper are messages of greetings to 
Secretary Kim Jong Il from foreign state and Party leaders 
and accounts of celebrating events in many countries on the 
occasion of his 55th birthday.
   It runs an article about Secretary Kim Jong Il's deep trust
and warm love for officials of the general association of 
Korean residents in Japan.
   President Kim Il Sung shocked the Japanese imperialists 
with superb tactics in the anti-Japanese armed struggle, the 
paper in an article says. It dedicates an article about the 
exploits of an indomitable revolutionary fighter, Kim Hyong 
Jik, to the 80th anniversary of the Korean National 
Association, which was formed by him on march 23, 1917.
   Econews of the paper includes increased coal production.
   The paper carries a commentary denouncing the Kim Young 
Sam group's suppression of progressive students and an 
article titled "the traitor is very one who wrecks  
stability of South Korean society."

articles.title: Production of electricity and minerals increases in Korea
articles.content:
Kim Won Gyun concert 
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A concert of composer Kim 
Won Gyun's music is going on in Pyongyang amid the concern 
of working people and lovers of music.
   It begins with the chorus of the immortal revolutionary 
song "Song of General Kim Il Sung" and "National Anthem" 
composed by him after the country was liberated in 1945.
   Its programme includes "March of Korea", "Our Supreme 
Commander", "We Rush Forward in Spirit of Chollima", "Song 
of Anti-Imperialist Struggle", "Glory to the Workers' Party 
of Korea" and many other songs and songs of revolutionary 
operas composed by him up to date since the country's 
liberation.
   The concert is being acclaimed by the audience for its 
varied artistic forms involving chorus, group singing, vocal 
solo and piano concerto and for excellent accomplishments of 
conductors, people's and merited actors and actresses.
   A few days ago, Kim Won Gyun greeted his 80th birthday.
   He is a Kim Il Sung Prize Winner, Labour Hero, People's 
Artist and a deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Pres. Kim Il Sung's 85th birth anniversary to be commemorated in Egypt
articles.content:
Production of electricity and minerals increases in Korea 
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Production of eletricity 
and minerals is increasing in Korea.
   The total electricity output of the ministry of electric 
power industry this month showed an increase of 10 
percent as against the same period of last month.
   The Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex is these days 
increasing its daily electric output by 50 percent on an 
average as compared with the like period of last month.
   The Pukchang Thermal Power Complex, the United March 17 
Hydroelectric Power Station and other power stations across 
the country are daily producing hundreds of thousands of kwh 
more electricity than their schedule.
   According to data available at the ministry of mining 
industry, its mineral output in a little more than two 
months of this year showed an increase of 60 percent over 
the corresponding period of last year.
   In this period, the Komdok Mining Complex Extracted 3,700 
more tons of minerals.
   Daily assignments are being overfulfilled also by the 
March 5 Youth Mine and the November 8 Mine in March.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam, wrecker of stability of S. Korean society
articles.content:
Pres. Kim Il Sung's 85th birth anniversary to be commemorated in Egypt 
   Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Cairo 
on Feb. 26 to form the preparatory committee for 
commemorating the 85th birth anniversary of the great leader 
President Kim Il Sung.
   A declaration on the formation was adopted at the 
meeting. 
   It noted that President Kim Il Sung, through his 
revolutionary activities, made immortal contributions to the 
independence of the world under the banner of anti-
imperialism and independence. For the contributions, he 
enjoyed deep respect and trust from the progressive people 
of the world as a veteran and famous statesman of the 
present era, it added.
   It was decided at the meeting to set the commemorating 
month from Mar. 15 to Apr. 15 of this year and hold colorful 
events during the period.
   The meeting appealed to all the countries and progressive 
people of the world aspiring after independence to 
commemorate President Kim Il Sung's 85th birth anniversary 
as an auspicious day common to mankind.
